metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6504 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Insufficient policy enforcement in notifications in Google Chrome prior to74.0.3729.108 allowed a remote attacker to bypass notification restrictionsvia a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6504` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
